intro: Gendarussa mollis, commonly known as the golden balsam, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its stems are hairy and branching. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
